Comments_List: The skills highlighted in this course will definitely be reading and writing.  Stever and Saito sensei do an absolutely AMAZING job at improving your reading comprehension. They always make the classes interesting and over the years it seems have created an absolutely amazing curriculum.
My Japanese reading skills greatly improved, and I learned more about Japanese authors and culture in general.

The class is structured very well!  I imagine that comes through the years and years of expertise that the two teachers have.  There is little that I could say is a weakness.  Definitely speak up in class!  it is much more engaging and enjoyable that way.
Yes! If you like Japanese continuing to take it is the best way to get better!
I would ABSOLUTELY recommend this course to another student.  Yale is very lucky to have such amazing Japanese language faculty!

Yes; it's not a stressful class by any means (especially since the class size is small and you would probably know the other members of the class well from studying Japanese in the past), but it does put pressure on you to learn the vocab and the kanji, so you come out feeling like you've gained a lot. The teachers are really kind and patient as well!
